content.en: Fluid dynamics algorithms: Researchers have been investigating various algorithms for solving fluid flow problems, such as the Stokes and Navier-Stokes equations. These algorithms aim to improve the accuracy and efficiency of numerical simulations. For example, one algorithm called the h-p adaptive spectral element method can handle complex decompositions and achieve refinements in both spatial and polynomial orders. Another algorithm, the Glowinski-Pironneau method, decomposes the problem into smaller equations to efficiently solve large-scale unsteady Stokes problems. These algorithms play a crucial role in advancing our understanding of fluid dynamics and improving engineering designs.
content.da: Fluiddynamiske algoritmer: Forskere har undersøgt forskellige algoritmer til løsning af problemer med væskestrømme, såsom Stokes- og Navier-Stokes-ligningerne. Disse algoritmer sigter mod at forbedre nøjagtigheden og effektiviteten af numeriske simuleringer. For eksempel kan en algoritme kaldet h-p adaptiv spektralelementmetode håndtere komplekse dekompositioner og opnå forbedringer både i rumlige og polynomiske ordener. En anden algoritme, Glowinski-Pironneau-metoden, dekomponerer problemet i mindre ligninger for effektivt at løse store ustadige Stokes-problemer. Disse algoritmer spiller en afgørende rolle i at fremme vores forståelse af fluiddynamik og forbedre tekniske design.
